00039 #include "mifare.h"
00040 
00041 #include <string.h>
00042 
00043 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00044 
00058 bool
00059 nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(nfc_device *pnd, const mifare_cmd mc, const uint8_t ui8Block, mifare_param *pmp)
00060 {
00061   uint8_t  abtRx[265];
00062   size_t  szParamLen;
00063   uint8_t  abtCmd[265];
00064   //bool    bEasyFraming;
00065 
00066   abtCmd[0] = mc;               // The MIFARE Classic command
00067   abtCmd[1] = ui8Block;         // The block address (1K=0x00..0x39, 4K=0x00..0xff)
00068 
00069   switch (mc) {
00070       // Read and store command have no parameter
00071     case MC_READ:
00072     case MC_STORE:
00073       szParamLen = 0;
00074       break;
00075 
00076       // Authenticate command
00077     case MC_AUTH_A:
00078     case MC_AUTH_B:
00079       szParamLen = sizeof(struct mifare_param_auth);
00080       break;
00081 
00082       // Data command
00083     case MC_WRITE:
00084       szParamLen = sizeof(struct mifare_param_data);
00085       break;
00086 
00087       // Value command
00088     case MC_DECREMENT:
00089     case MC_INCREMENT:
00090     case MC_TRANSFER:
00091       szParamLen = sizeof(struct mifare_param_value);
00092       break;
00093 
00094       // Please fix your code, you never should reach this statement
00095     default:
00096       return false;
00097       break;
00098   }
00099 
00100   // When available, copy the parameter bytes
00101   if (szParamLen)
00102     memcpy(abtCmd + 2, (uint8_t *) pmp, szParamLen);
00103 
00104   // FIXME: Save and restore bEasyFraming
00105   // bEasyFraming = nfc_device_get_property_bool (pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, &bEasyFraming);
00106   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, true) < 0) {
00107     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00108     return false;
00109   }
00110   // Fire the mifare command
00111   int res;
00112   if ((res = nfc_initiator_transceive_bytes(pnd, abtCmd, 2 + szParamLen, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), -1))  < 0) {
00113     if (res == NFC_ERFTRANS) {
00114       // "Invalid received frame",  usual means we are
00115       // authenticated on a sector but the requested MIFARE cmd (read, write)
00116       // is not permitted by current acces bytes;
00117       // So there is nothing to do here.
00118     } else {
00119       nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_initiator_transceive_bytes");
00120     }
00121     // XXX nfc_device_set_property_bool (pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, bEasyFraming);
00122     return false;
00123   }
00124   /* XXX
00125   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool (pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, bEasyFraming) < 0) {
00126     nfc_perror (pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00127     return false;
00128   }
00129   */
00130 
00131   // When we have executed a read command, copy the received bytes into the param
00132   if (mc == MC_READ) {
00133     if (res == 16) {
00134       memcpy(pmp->mpd.abtData, abtRx, 16);
00135     } else {
00136       return false;
00137     }
00138   }
00139   // Command succesfully executed
00140   return true;
00141 }
